sub_title: Intern at the International Criminal Court Office of the Prosecutor | Double LLM cum laude | BSc cum laude
summary:
Aspiring international lawyer, passionate about international criminal justice, human rights and  environmental law.

Double Master in Laws from the University of Amsterdam. 1st Master's Cum Laude in International and Transnational Criminal law with activites including a legal research internship in an international criminal tribunal and participation in the ICC Moot Court competition as counsel for the Prosecution. 2nd Master's in Public International Law with a specialisation in human rights law and participation in a European Law Clinic working with a public interest refugee law case for an NGO.

BSc Cum Laude of International Relations and Organisations at Leiden University + Honours Academy graduate (78 ECs in International Law, ranging from EU law, international criminal justice, human rights law and migration law)

treasury_media.title: Artivism and Youth Engagement in Corona
treasury_media.description: Article reporting on my internship with Amnesty International, in which I investigated ways to boost community engagement with political issues at a time of apathy and disengagement, brought about by the transition to online education and interactions due to the coronavirus measures. My "case-study" was the university student community in the Hague and the topic of engagement was human rights and youth. The medium: artivism.

education.field_of_study: Political Science: International Relations and Organisations

awards.title: Best Government Counsel Team
awards.description: My team and I won the award for best Government Counsel team in the 2023 edition of the ICC IBA Moot Court competition. The selection was made on the basis of our written memorial, which I co-authored with two teammates, and on the performance of our team at the oral rounds. My contribution focused on a legal argumentative analysis of the elements of the Crime Against Humanity of 'other inhumane acts' under Article 7(1)(k) and the contextual elements for CAH under the Rome Statute.

awards.title: Second runner-up Best Government Counsel Memorial
awards.description: Our team won the 3rd place for Best Government Counsel memorial, among 80+ participating teams from around the world. I co-authored the Memorial with the help of two other teammates. My contribution focused on legal argumentation on behalf of the government party to the fictional ICC proceedings of the 2023 ICC Moot Court edition. I focused on the contextual elements and elements of the crime for Crimes Against Humanity (in particular the residual clause 7(1)(k) of the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court).

profile_positions.description: Providing legal research assistance to the Now You See Me (Moria) NGO dealing with EU migration at the Greek borders. Public interest law case with special focus on the rights of migrant children, examining refugee camps and the human rights violations therein.
profile_positions.title: Legal Researcher in EU Migration Law

company.name: Amsterdam Law Clinics - University of Amsterdam

profile_positions.company: Amsterdam Law Clinics - University of Amsterdam
profile_positions.description: Through the Amsterdam Criminal Justice Law Clinic at the UvA our team provides research assistance to an international criminal tribunal based in the Hague.
profile_positions.title: Legal Adviser for International Court

profile_positions.description:
In this position, I was responsible for coordinating the efforts of a motivated team of interns in investigating and reporting on human rights violations of minority groups in Pakistan. Our team raised awareness of the deteriorating situation of minority rights in the country. Furthermore, I was responsible for external partnerships with Pakistani-focused NGOs and GHRD contacts on-the-ground, as well as for organising educational panels and protest activities to advance the goals of GHRD and team Pakistan.

An important initiative I organised during my term as cooridnator was a panel on the rights of gender minorities in Pakistan, such as trans women and non-binary folks. The panelists included individuals working on the ground in Pakistan to advance gender equality. The panel included a medical practitioner providing safe access to abortions, especially for people of diverse gender identities; another panelist was a grassroots organiser and foundational member of the Aurat march (the women's march in Pakistan) who could share their diverse experiences in activities promoting gender awareness and equality in a country with high risk of retaliation for such actions.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator for human rights investigative team of Pakistan

profile_positions.description: Reporting on and raising awareness of the violation of minority rights in Pakistan
profile_positions.title: Legal Intern

profile_positions.description: I represented my study programme in the Bachelor's Open Days and Experience Days. I attended Dutch high school visits and informed prospective students of my experience studying International Relations and Organisations in Leiden University. I also gave campus tours. The position requires excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a high degree of versatility and adaptability as well as strong promotional skills.
profile_positions.title: Bachelor's Programme Community Officer

company.name: Amnesty International Student Group The Hague

profile_positions.company: Amnesty International Student Group The Hague
profile_positions.description: I organised an art competition with the theme of Youth and Human Rights as part of a campaign I started with the Amnesty Student Group to increase community engagement with Human Rights. Within this internship placement, I conducted research on what conditions stimulate youth engagement with human rights issues in a case-study of international students in the Hague. The desired outcome of my research was to rekindle community engagement with the yearly-scheduled Amnesty International initiatives, such as the Write for Rights, following the drop in activism engagement brought about by the onset of the coronavirus.  During the research project, I applied theories of civil participation through “artivism” to the real-life situation in the Hague’s young community.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
Writing for the political science student magazine of the SPIL study association I explored research topics of great interest to me about the interactions between social, political and cultural dynamics and what repercussions they may entail. 
Examples: 
I explored the change in discourse in the environmental crisis as affected by the actions and statements of former (incumbent at that time) US president Donald Trump; I explored how the dark colonial past of the US and brutal institutionalised slavery may have contributed to higher levels of religiosity in the African American population in the US using national statistics; I investigated, through a small-N qualitative research, three Mediterranean countries' rocky journeys with populism and tried to analyse the similarities and differences to come up with contextual answers about the rise in populism in those states.
profile_positions.title: Writer

volunteer_experiences.description: I participated in the 2023 ICC Moot Court competition in a fictional case scenario designed to teach law students about the law of the ICC as well as the procedure of litigating before the Court. I was the University of Amsterdam's speaker for the Prosecution Counsel of the International Criminal Court.

volunteer_experiences.role: President of the General Assembly, Chair, Delegate
volunteer_experiences.description:
Participated in 9 Model UN Conferences throughout my secondary education.
6 as a delegate (3x Best Delegate award) 
2 as a Chair (Special Political and Decolonisation Committee + Economic and Financial Committee) 
1 as the President of the General Assembly

Responsibilities of the position included overseeing the work of our multiple committees and coordinating the several events they hold, communicating with the University about our organisation's initiatives, working on sustainability, community engagement and inclusion and diversity policies for the organisation. Weekly Board meetings involved discussing ways to advance the goals of our organisation, to effectively engage the community during the global health crisis in a safe manner, and to revolutionise socialisation in the university context through University associations.

volunteer_experiences.role: Head of Arts and Media Committee
volunteer_experiences.description: As the first Chairperson to oversee the committee, I was responsible for the creation and development of our creative goal from the ground up. I stimulated individual projects of the commissioners I was overseeing, assisting them in any of their problems, contacting external partners and coming up with techniques to engage our University's community. Organised a musical event with a local pub to our campus and managed to connect artists and art-enthusiasts in our university with a very significant turnout. Partnership was sustained. Engaged the community with 'artivism' and political engagement through art. Managed to raise awareness on several sociopolitical issues, such as period poverty, and raise money for a charity working to uproot the systemic issue at the root of this problem. This was achieved through the sales of mass-produced artwork by the student members of the committee, managing to further stimulate our audience by working with them to advance our goals.
